intro: Scleria phylloptera, commonly known as the broad-leaf sedges, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along waterways. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies. Scleria phylloptera plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
